definition[0]: the time in the evening when the largest number of people are watching television
example[3]: a speech that was broadcast live during prime time
definition[1]: relating to the time in the evening when most people are watching television, and the cost of advertising is at its most expensive
example[4]: The three major networksâ€™ combined share of the prime-time audience has fallen to a new low.
example[5]: Warner will have about 20 series on prime-time television in the fall.
definition[2]: the time when most people are watching the television or listening to the radio, and therefore the most expensive time for advertising
example[6]: The President usedprime time television for a brief, personalised appeal to voters.
example[7]: Prime time is just before the 8 o'clock news.
